definition: the final bell (esp. in sports competition)

sentences.english: The women of the house seemed not to feel that the sound had meaning for them.
sentences.chinese: 家中的女人们感到这锣声跟她们无关。

sentences.english: In the mid-day the gong sounds at the palace gate.
sentences.chinese: 中午，锣声在庙殿门前敲起。

sentences.english: On the stroke of seven, a gong summons guests into the dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 7点整时一阵锣声将客人召集到餐厅。

sentences.english: The sound of three bangs on a gong signalled the impending arrival of Kim’s son and grandson.
sentences.chinese: 三声锣声宣示金日成的儿子和孙子的即将到来。

sentences.english: The room resounded wtih each beat of the gong.
sentences.chinese: 这间屋子回荡着阵阵锣声。

sentences.english: Today's art lesson came to an abrupt end when the gongs sounded for a fire drill.
sentences.chinese: 今天的艺术课是乏味的，锣声像刺耳的钻子。

definition: Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
watchman's clapper/wooden clappers with bars of unequal length
suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
